fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Have some commit/pr with comments on a certain section
# Refactor the section so that comments disappear
# Check “Comments on prior versions” feature
# Modal opens
# Try to reply to some of the comments so that text editor opens
# Try to open Emoji menu

*Expected*

Emoji menu displays on top of the “Comments on prior versions” modal

*Actual*

Emoji menu is displayed underneath.

*Reason*

Obvious one. Incorrect z-index of the Emoji popup menu.

!2064553909-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Comments on prior version" modal and emoticons menu z-index issue

fields.description:
When creating a new branch using the “Create branch” option inside of an issue the generated name does not escape slashes present in the issue name.

Example:

Issue Name: ISSUE-123 Enable/Disable energy saving mode

Automatic branch name: ISSUE-123 Enable/Disable energy saving mode

which leads to the creation of a directory with the name {{ISSUE-123 Enable}} and a branch with the name {{Disable energy saving mode}}
fields.summary: "Create branch" unexpected behavior

fields.description:
* curl -X POST -H 'Authorization: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx' [https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/peoplestrongalt/apa/refs/branches|https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/peoplestrongalt/apa/refs/branches]\\
Access denied. You must have write or admin access
fields.summary: Getting Access denied While Trying To Get Branches Names Using API

fields.description: Whenever I go to pull requests page in bitbucket, there is no search bar to search from. Instead, there are a set of filters for that. Although, they do get the work done, I think search bars are way more intuitive than filters.
fields.summary: No Search bar in Pull Requests view in Bitbucket

fields.description:
Users are unable to add Sonar App from Marketplace in Bitbucket.

Users are getting "RequestTimeoutError" while adding Sonar app from Marketplace.
fields.summary: Users are unable to add Sonar App from Marketplace in Bitbucket

fields.description:
This error occurs when a project have several issues that have identical updated_on timestamps.

The repositories/user/project/issues will include some issues in more than one page, while some issues are not included in any page.

It is probably impossible to get to this state by normal means, but by using the export/import function I created more than 40 issues with identical properties except for id and title.  I did this in order to test that my tool handled the pagination correctly.

Ordering by id worked as expected, but the default ordering and sort=updated_on triggered the bug.
fields.summary: Bad pagination in Issues API when issues have identical timestamps

fields.description:
h3. Repro Steps
# Login to my Bitbucket cloud site
# Click “Create Pull Request”
# Start Authoring my Pull Request
# Continue Authoring until …

*Result:* Page Hangs

*Expected:* Page doesn’t hang, able to author and save my PR without resorting to screenshots and retyping.

h3. Possible “Triggers”
I’ve been experiencing this problem for a long time now and have several conjectures about what triggers the hang.

# Trying to select text with the mouse and starting a drag event from the padding region of the editor pane (eg: between the editor border and the left hand edge of my text)
# Using emacs key bindings to navigate around the text (ie: {{ctrl-e}} or {{ctrl-a}})
# Authoring an especially large PR.

h3. Notes
* This has been happening for roughly a year
* I used to use Safari to author PRs, but it got so bad that I switched to Chrome
* Other members of my team have been reporting the same thing
* Just happened 3 times in the last hour despite a reboot.
* Seems to be getting worse with time.
* Have only experienced this crash when Creating a PR, not when Editing a PR.

h3. Environment:
* MacOS 10.14.6 (current)
* Chrome (77)
* 2018 MPB w/ 16g Ram

----
*NOTE:* Sorry if I’m not “supposed” to file bugs directly. I clicked the “support request” link above, and it brought me to the Bitbucket resources page. I clicked on bugs, and it brought me back here. Searches of Community and this Jira instances came up empty.
fields.summary: Authoring Pull Requests often results in Page Hang or Crash

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to ask for a feature request. When we create a user group we can assign already added team members or send invitations for new members inside members tab. On the other tab (repositories) we can only list repositories that already have access on their related levels. (read, write, admin, all)

!428751829-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-22%20at%2017.06.34.png|thumbnail!\\
I would like to ask, if you could add a feature where we can also give/remove access for repositories for selected user group under repositories tab or more appropriate place. Otherwise each time we have to go to settings of the repository which we want to give or remove access for. And it seems not practical enough.

!3661072152-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-22%20at%2017.06.57.png|thumbnail!\\
Thanks for your interest.
fields.summary: Ability to grant repository access on user groups page under team settings

fields.description:
I was trying to add a new remote repository, when I got this error:\\
!148010509-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-21%20at%204.24.04%20PM.png|thumbnail!

So I tried to sign in, and I got this:\\
!1265493973-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-21%20at%204.22.28%20PM.png|thumbnail!

Interestingly, though, when I clicked on the hamburger menu, I was signed in and was able to see the "Your work" section with my pull requests and everything. So I hit cancel. I got the error message of "Refreshing Remote Repositories Failed" again, so I signed in again, and this time it went straight to the "Your work" section of bitbucket. There wasn't anything I could do except click around the website or hit cancel. So I hit cancel, but then I still wasn't signed in. So I quit Sourcetree and opened it again, and then I got that error message of "Refreshing Remote Repositories Failed" again. I tried to sign in again, and this time, I got this:\\
!396136038-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-21%20at%204.25.43%20PM.png|thumbnail!

which was the same "Your work" screen again, except this time it said I was connected. But there was still nothing for me to do except click around or hit cancel! And when I hit cancel, it said I was still not signed in!

As a side note, when I went to the support page for bitbucket:\\
!3805289348-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-21%20at%204.38.31%20PM.png|thumbnail!

the link that says "Download the latest version for macOS" is broken:\\
!2132019295-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-21%20at%204.30.43%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot sign into Sourcetree via Bitbucket

fields.description:
I noticed couple of days ago that links to the headings inside of markdown document no longer work. This behavior was observed both when logged in and accessing them as anonymous. Even the example markdown [https://bitbucket.org/tutorials/markdowndemo/src/master/|https://bitbucket.org/tutorials/markdowndemo/src/master/] does not work anymore. Clicking on any link to the heading in that document just reloads the same page.

This bug renders markdown documentation files very difficult to navigate.
fields.summary: Links to the headings in the markdown files no longer work

We want to write some automation that downloads artifacts from completed pipelines to test them on some physical devices within our network, but as far as I can tell from the API the artifacts are not exposed as part of the pipeline response.

fields.description:
I like the changed icon, but removing the icon-only side menu functionality is a problem.

Now, users like me who want to maximize their space by having the sidebar collapsed have to instead hover over or toggle the side bar every single time they want to navigate to a sidebar item.

Additionally, users who are accustomed to having the expanded sidebar are losing an extra sidebar’s worth of width from their workspace.

‌

At most, this feature should be optional. I 10000% prefer to have the collapsed sidebar. The little arrow expander was slightly finnicky but it worked. This new sidebar negatively affects my productivity and positive perception of the BitBucket website
fields.summary: New sidebar is the worst of both worlds

Sometimes it appears properly and only then I can merge and work further. I am facing this issue from last few times

If you’re not going to provide Mercurial support, the very least you could do is release this part of Bitbucket cloud to the open-source community.
fields.summary: Open-source Bitbucket Cloud for Mercurial

fields.description:
Hello World,

So my team has been developing a API and portal concurrently, and we’ve been using pipelines to build and deploy our Docker images to AWS ECS. There is an issue where sometimes there is an API change and we want to build it and prepare it for deployment but wait until the portal dev is ready, to prevent breaking changes since the admin portal isn’t up yet and the rest of us need to be able to access it. We fixed this issue by adding a manual step, so the portal dev can simply go into bitbucket, and hit the manual step after he’s ready. But we’ve found the Slack integration to be slightly lackluster.

When a manual step finishes, it appears as a full pipeline in Slack, so if you have two steps with a manual button between them, you get a message for when the pipeline starts, than you get a pipeline completed success or fail for the first step, than a success or fail for the second. This makes just peeking at a slack message on my phone kinda ineffective, because I don’t know if that success was the first step, or the second step. It would be nice to get a slack message that says a step has completed, than when the full pipeline is done, you get the normal success or failure message. To add to this, the reason for making this post, it would also be nice to be able to hit a button on the message between manual steps to approve and start the next step, similarly to re-running a failed pipeline now. This allows us to do a full deployment, without having to go into bitbucket, go to the repo, then deployments, than the deployment, than hitting the button. We could just go into slack and hit next.

‌

Thanks for consideration,

Samuel [~1f4e676b31f6]
fields.summary: Adding Manual Step Approval in Slack

It was the case all this morning (August 20) than this afternoon it got back to normal.

Of course, when it occurs, we are blocked : we can’t review pull requests anymore :disappointed:

We had have a wiki on one of our git repos and it is set as the landing page. Some times ago (maybe several months), the landing page switched to source view and we can’t get it to show the wiki, even when changing it to something else and back.

‌

Thanks!
fields.summary: Landing page wiki option appears broken

fields.description:
The commit could not be found in the cloned repository. This can be caused by using force push, or not having a deep enough clone.

This is intermittent as it fails randomly. Also after a fail If I click rerun it succeeds.  The pipeline in question has clone depth full.

‌

{{options: docker: true}}

{{clone: depth: full}}

‌

The fact the pipelines dont work blocks ci/cd.
fields.summary: pipeline fails with not have deep enough clone

fields.description: Inside the {{Commits}} section, can’t search for branch specific commits. It shows all branches while searching.
fields.summary: Searching a commit in a particular branch is not possible

fields.description:
when creating a branch from a Jira issue on Bitbucket cloud, the branch would get the name of the issue but it would be normalized with certain characters being removed.

now, this changed a few days ago where now if the issue had brackets in the name like “[topic] some issue” then the branch is created with the first bracket removed and named like this “ID-topic]-some-issue”

‌

this is clearly not the desired behavior. this breaks our process as docker tags are taken from the branch name and brackets are illegal characters in docker tags.

i would like to have this feature return to as it was working earlier for more than year that we are using it in this way with no problems, i don’t want to have to change our process.
fields.summary: creating branch from jira issue behavior change and brackets remain

fields.description:
Bitbucket settings is aware, according to the "Branching Model" settings page, of a {{Development Branch}} and a {{Production Branch}}.

In our organisation, it would be useful for us to have different default merge strategies for these.

More specifically for our use case, we do the following

# Create a feature branch based on the development branch
# Several commits later, we’re ready to PR
# When the branch is PRd, we merge it into the development branch. _For this we would like to use squash commits, so that only the total change is recorded from the branch, not the wip commits in between_
# Several branch merges into development later, we’re ready to merge development branch into production branch ready for a release candidate
# Create and merge a PR from development branch to production branch. _For this we do not want squash, we want to merge so that we have different commit history for each PR made_
# release production branch

As you can see, merging into development branch and production branch have different use cases that it would be very useful to be able to set different defaults for in terms of merge strategies.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Use different default merge strategies for different branch types.

fields.description:
In particular, if the ticket has a ‘ in it, like “It’s impossible to do this or that” is turned into branch name

“ABC-123-It’s-impossible-to-do-this-or-that”. The ‘ in it’s should have been removed too for git to accept this name, like this

“ABC-123-Its-impossible-to-do-this-or-that”.
fields.summary: Branch names from ticket names are sometimes not accepted by git

fields.description:
When I create a new branch from the Jira item, Bitbucket used to clean up invalid filename characters in in Windows. Now it doesn’t

[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1976007/what-characters-are-forbidden-in-windows-and-linux-directory-names|https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1976007/what-characters-are-forbidden-in-windows-and-linux-directory-names]

‌

Steps:

# Create a Jira item with an invalid windows filename character in the name:

!4000570509-image.png|thumbnail!\\
2. Press the “Create Branch” button on the Jira item

3. On the “Create branch” screen the name given for the new branch now contains the invalid path characters:

!3559229171-image.png|thumbnail!\\
4. Press the “Create” button. If you try and switch to this new branch from a windows machine, it fails

Bitbucket used to be smart enough to remove these characters, but this functionality was lost in the last few days
fields.summary: Branch creation from JIRA allows invalid Windows file path characters
HTML special characters are escaped when you edit the issue in issue tracker

fields.description:
This issue has been on-and-off again for our team for moths. After several page refreshes it usually kicks in ( which is a pain). But today it seems persistent/permanent. Regardless of selecting “All”, “Active”, or “Merged”, no ahead/behind commit status is shown.

This is VERY frustrating.
fields.summary: Ahead/behind commit status is currently un available

fields.description:
We have users with same First / Last Name and for one user a nick is not displayed

page: account/user/XXXXXXX/groups/administrators/

So my user list is displayed like

*What I get:*

Tim Cook

Tim Cook (NICK2)

Steve Jobs (NICK3)

‌

*What I expect*

Tim Cook (NICK1)

Tim Cook (NICK2)

Steve Jobs (NICK3)

‌

Please advise!
fields.summary: Some bitbucket nicknames are not displayed for some reason on group's user management pages

fields.description:
We are using the Ansible module ([https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/bitbucket_pipeline_variable_module.html|https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/bitbucket_pipeline_variable_module.html]) to mange our repository Variables.

For repositories with more than 10 variables, we got an 401 unauthorized error. I think the problem is, that this module uses OAuth consumers, which ere not authorized for the “next” response URL, which is the old API, see below…

The module usese the following URL: {{api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/pipelines_config/variables/}}

The module loops over the pages, but the mentioned endpoint returns a the link to the old API ([https://bitbucket-pipelines.prod.public.atl-paas.net/rest/1.0/accounts/|https://bitbucket-pipelines.prod.public.atl-paas.net/rest/1.0/accounts/]….)

Why is this URL responded and not api.bitbucket.org/2.0/….?
fields.summary: Pagination "next" URL not responding as expected

fields.description:
File lock system introduced in GIT LFS 2.0 does not work with Bitbucket.

[[https://github.blog/2017-03-02-git-lfs-2-0-0-released/|https://github.blog/2017-03-02-git-lfs-2-0-0-released/]](https://github.blog/2017-03-02-git-lfs-2-0-0-released)

We are getting below error:

Lock failed: Repository or object not found: [https://<username>@bitbucket.org/|https://%3Cusername%3E%40bitbucket.org/]<urnm>/<repo>.git/info/lfs/locks\\
Check that it exists and that you have proper access to it
fields.summary: Git lock does not work with Bitbucket

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to to ignore certain files at merging is by doing a custom merge strategy: [https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Customizing-Git-Git-Attributes#_merge_strategies|https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Customizing-Git-Git-Attributes#_merge_strategies] and do the merges locally

It could be a useful feature if it would be supported by Bitbucket Cloud GUI.
fields.summary: Ignore certain files when merging a branch into another

fields.description:
h3. Summary
participated_on in pull request API endpoint is giving different result inconsistently. The pull requests API has a bug where it incorrectly uses comments for the timestamp even if the participant is an approver.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a pull request with at least one reviewer.
# Have the reviewer approve the pull request.
# Have the reviewer leave a comment on the pull request.
# Have the reviewer unapprove the pull request.
# Have the reviewer approve the pull request.

h3. Expected Results
participated_on time output should be the same across endpoint

h3. Actual Results
participated_on time output is inconsistent
fields.summary: Pullrequest participant "participated_on" timestamp is inconsistent

fields.description: Currently, we only have API support for groups in 1.0 but no user API. It would be great if we can have support for user as well.
fields.summary: API support for user permission

fields.summary: Can't find repos in list

fields.description:
Hi,

We are using git plugin with Bitbucket to trigger our CI, the CI is triggering huge number of builds for all opened PR even if no update was added to it. Going through the logs of jenkins master, we were able to see the following exception, can you please let us know why you are rejecting our ssl certificate of [jenkins-ci.freightos.com|http://jenkins-ci.freightos.com] domain:\\
Aug 18, 2019 2:28:22 PM WARNING bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.bitbucket.ApiClient send\\
Failed to send request.\\
java.io.EOFException: SSL peer shut down incorrectly\\
at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.read(InputRecord.java:505)\\
at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:975)\\
Caused: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: Remote host closed connection during handshake\\
at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:994)\\
at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.performInitialHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1367)\\
at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.writeRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:750)\\
at sun.security.ssl.AppOutputStream.write(AppOutputStream.java:123)\\
at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flushBuffer(BufferedOutputStream.java:82)\\
at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flush(BufferedOutputStream.java:140)\\
at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection.flushRequestOutputStream(HttpConnection.java:835)\\
at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.writeRequest(HttpMethodBase.java:2123)\\
at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase.execute(HttpMethodBase.java:1103)\\
at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeWithRetry(HttpMethodDirector.java:405)\\
at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeMethod(HttpMethodDirector.java:178)\\
at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:404)\\
at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:330)\\
at bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.bitbucket.ApiClient.send(ApiClient.java:180)\\
at bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.bitbucket.ApiClient.get(ApiClient.java:126)\\
at bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.bitbucket.cloud.CloudApiClient.hasBuildStatus(CloudApiClient.java:54)\\

at bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.bitbucketpullrequestbuilder.BitbucketRepository.getTargetPullRequests(BitbucketRepository.java:120)\\

Rawan
fields.summary: Jenkins bitbucket Git plugin is not working properly as remote host is shutting down the connection

fields.description: Since about 3 weeks, the repository overview of other users are lacking a way to sort the list ([https://gyazo.com/e053ead9f1270596de57c9e16ba941fb|https://gyazo.com/e053ead9f1270596de57c9e16ba941fb]). As logged in users, the sort order is completely arbitrary, making it completely useless e.g. for getting a quick overview what has changed recently. The only way to have it sorted by last update date is by viewing it not logged in. In contrast if you open the list of watched repositories on your dashboard, there is an option to sort that list ([https://gyazo.com/6297647f40dd3dc3d26ed12f8d4634f9|https://gyazo.com/6297647f40dd3dc3d26ed12f8d4634f9]).
fields.summary: No sort option for other user's repository list - completely unusable

fields.description:
I have 4 Atlassian accounts, 3 for different companies I work for, and one private. I am constantly switching between them. This requires logging out, and logging in which requires finding and entering my password for that account several times a day. What a pain!

Also, you can only have one account open at a time, as your auth cookies are browser wide.

The way google drive works is that that you can add your accounts, and then pick any of them from a dropdown. Most of the time, you cont need to authenticate again. Much more usable.

Also, you can have two browser windows open with two different users. This would be a huge benefit for using bitbucket/altlassian products.

Currently, I use Bitbucket for some accounts, and GitHub for others, as it means I can have both open at the same time with two different users.
fields.summary: allow switching of users, like drive.google.com does, and, ideally, allow multiple tabs with multiple users.

fields.description:
We would like to have a functionality that allow us to add "known hosts" in the Project or Account level as our environment/code is split in several repositories and, these are all deployed to the same servers.

It would make it easy to:

# Manage known hosts
# Keep all repositories update to date
fields.summary: Make it possible to add known hosts in the account level (BBS-113207)

fields.description:
I create a repository link with the information:

Link URL: [http://gesti.eme4.inf.br/gesti/atendimento/chamado_detalhes.php?COD_CHAMADO=\1|http://gesti.eme4.inf.br/gesti/atendimento/chamado_detalhes.php%3FCOD_CHAMADO%3D%255C1]\\
Link Key: (GES-\d+)

But do not work if the number contains more of 6 caracteres.\\
Sample:

GES-234\\
[GES-234|http://gesti.eme4.inf.br/gesti/atendimento/chamado_detalhes.php%3FCOD_CHAMADO%3D234]\\
Works!

‌

GES-3479374637\\
GES-[3476374637|https://bitbucket.org/devtotall/totallcommerce/commits/3476374637]\\
The Bitbucket create a link in 123456789 to Bitbucket website.

‌
fields.summary: Problema with repository link

fields.description:
The azure-storage-deploy pipeline 1.1.1 uses azcopy 7.3 which does not set content type properly on some file types (SVG for example). This means that after deploying to a static website on a Blob storage some file types will not be displayed properly in a web browser until the content type is changed manually from application/octet-stream which is the default type used by azcopy for “unknown” filetypes.

Please update the pipeline to use a version of azcopy that manage to properly set the content types on uploaded files.
fields.summary: The azure-storage-deploy uses outdated azcopy

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Assume a Pull request from branch A to branch B, that gets merged with Squash.

If we then open a new PR from branch A to branch B, the same commits of branch A (that were already merged in branch B) show up in the list of commits for this PR. The diff will show no changes.

This can be confusing to users, as (i) there is a discrepancy between diff and commits in the PR and (ii) the commits have already been squash merged to branch B.

h3. Suggested Solution
Detect whether commits from the source branch have already been squash merged to the target branch, and omit those commits from the PR commit list.
fields.summary: In PR Commits list don't show commits that have been merged to the target branch via a squash merge

fields.description:
*Logging in to Atlassian services*

* attempt to log in (redacted)
* login page does either

** appears to log in, redirects and arrives back at the homepage not logged in
** sits there forever, looking at the network tab the 'authenticate' request returns 200 but doesn't seem to return any data, still logged out
* tested in chrome and firefox
* colleagues are having similar issues with odd redirection / reproducing issue.
* managed to log in at (redacted) however can still occassionally reproduce with that account, seems intermittent. The (redacted) consistently fails to log in.
fields.summary: Issues logging into Bitbucket/JIRA

fields.description:
At the moment, it's possible to enable two-step verification globally for an account.\\
However, it would be nice if this could be enabled only on a per-repository basis.
fields.summary: Ability to configure two-step verification on a per repo basis

fields.description: We’ve configured Qlik REST Connector to use Bitbucket Server REST API with Basic authentication. Sometimes the invokation of /rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/branches returns 401 with OAuth Error. The credentials are valid, the requisite permission is available.
fields.summary: OAuth Error 401 with valid Basic credential

fields.description:
Sometimes people forget to put the Jira issue in commit messages. If a branch is associated with a Jira issue, via the “Create branch” link on a Jira issue, PRs for that branch should have an explicit link to the Jira issue, rather than depending on the issue tag in commit messages.

!1077883960-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: PRs associated with Jira issues should have an explicit link to the issue

fields.description:
In the commits or branch view Jira issue tags in commit messages are identified and turned into hyperlinks (bottom image). This doesn’t work on the pull request page (top image).

!1670987555-delme.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue links not shown (not linkified) in new pull request page > commits

fields.description:
When hitting the {{Swap destination and Source}} button in the Compare view of two commits or branches, the button does nothing.

See below:

Before clicking the swap button

!2654548630-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-15%20at%2010.42.44%20AM.png|thumbnail!\\
‌

After pressing the swap button: notice that the URL hasnt changed, but the source/destination in the UI has changed.

!4127377343-Screen%20Shot%202019-08-15%20at%2010.42.55%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Compare individual commits on the branch compare view

fields.description: x
fields.summary: x

fields.description:
When Bitbucket is facing a widespread incident, it shows an orange banner in the UI stating that Bitbucket is facing issues.

Currently, it's not possible to close or stop it from showing up. This feature request is to request the ability to add this ability on future incidents.
fields.summary: BBS-113974 Ability to close the incident banner

fields.description:
The version of Docker used by Bitbucket pipelines is still on {{18.09.1}} which is [nearly 9 months out of date|https://github.com/docker/docker-ce/releases/tag/v18.09.1]. As of this post, [version 19|https://github.com/docker/docker-ce/releases] was released 22 days ago and [patched two days later|https://github.com/docker/docker-ce/releases/tag/v19.03.1].

[As of July 2018|https://blog.docker.com/2018/07/extending-support-cycle-docker-community-edition/], Docker has an established and predictable 6 month release cycle. It would be best if Bitbucket pipelines stayed in lock step with this. Alternatively, allow us to define the version of Docker we would like to use.

At a minimum, patch versions should be available ASAP for security and bug fixes. However major versions typically have much desired new features. Also, Docker has gotten much better at maintaining backwards compatibility with deprecation notices.

Please upgrade Docker to the current version for Bitbucket pipelines.
fields.summary: BitBucket Pipelines: Upgrade Docker to version 19

fields.description:
I am unable to login to BitBucket. My username is accepted. When I enter the password—which I am certain is valid—I am not shown an error message. Rather, login appears to succeed, but I am redirected to the Bitbucket home page instead of to my dashboard.

I am managing with an unclosed authenticated session in another browser, but if I lose that, I will be unable to use the system.
fields.summary: Unable to Login to BitBucket

fields.description:
I love the new issue tracker editor, with one frustrating exception.

When I create an issue and start typing, after a few seconds or so, the description field transforms into the new editor and captures keyboard focus. Whatever you were typing is now captured. If this happened immediately it’d be okay, but there’s a very significant lag between the form being usable and the description field capturing all text.

So every single time I use it, half the text goes in the title, and half is grabbed by the description. It actually costs me significant extra typing and editing to mash the two together and start typing the description.

Please please please make the issue tracker preserve the keyboard focus in the title when the markdown editing magic starts up.
fields.summary: Changing keyboard focus in the new issue tracker is annoying

fields.description:
Repo: [[https://bitbucket.org/kokua/kokua-sl/commits/|https://bitbucket.org/kokua/kokua-sl/commits/]](https://bitbucket.org/kokua/kokua-sl/commits)

Commit: [https://bitbucket.org/kokua/kokua-sl/commits/613f4faa5e1fd35f298e4b2db1e15f195171cb5a|https://bitbucket.org/kokua/kokua-sl/commits/613f4faa5e1fd35f298e4b2db1e15f195171cb5a] references a pull request made to a different repo, however clicking on the link that’s been created goes this repo’s [PR#56|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/56] which is something entirely different and unrelated to this commit
fields.summary: Commit view incorrectly generates pull request URLs

fields.description:
[https://bitbucket.org/kokua/kokua-sl/commits/|https://bitbucket.org/kokua/kokua-sl/commits/] revisions aaa3f57 and 64286e6 are current tips and also bookmarks; the bookmark indicator is no longer shown in the commit display

Since this repo uses bookmarks rather than named branches to manage its branches this is a major pain

The screenshot shows how the top of the repository looks in TortoiseHg with the bookmarks shown
fields.summary: Mercurial repos no longer show bookmarks in commit view

fields.description:
At the current moment, when integrated with Bitbucket Cloud, the Slack notifications can be too simple such as just  mentioning the branch name or informing that “someone” approved your pull request etc.

It would be great if the message body can be configured to be more verbose and provided more detailed information such as the repository name etc.

Otherwise, it would also be great if users are able to create templates for these Slack notifications, allowing them to use custom messages.
fields.summary: Allow users to modify the messages of Slack notifications

fields.description:
Chrome 77 shows a warning about unsafe content when visiting bitbucket.org

!1031503827-bitbucket.org.png|thumbnail!\\
And in the developers menu it looks like this

!4052212696-bitbucket2.org.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Chrome 77 shows a warning about unsafe content when visiting bitbucket.org

fields.description: !2216902882-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Likes don't show on comment. See example photo below.

fields.description: It would be a useful feature if we could authorize repository access based on IP or SSH key access. In case the user’s IP is not in the Access Control list (as that person has a dynamic IP address), but in case his SSH key is in the list, Bitbucket Cloud would allow to perform the Git operation.
fields.summary: Authorize repository access based on IP or SSH key

fields.description: If you add a really long variable to your account or repository, the page will shift the variable values to the right quite a lot.
fields.summary: BBS-113875 - Long Account/Repository variables break page formatting

fields.description: It would be a useful feature if Pipelines would support the log output through “consola” ([https://www.npmjs.com/package/consola|https://www.npmjs.com/package/consola]) and the Pipelines build would stop, once “consola” found an issue with the build
fields.summary: Add support for consola

fields.description: Whenever you create a new account or new team account and create the very first repository on that account, the boards tab will be visible. If you click on it, it will show no content. If the page is refreshed, then the board tab will disappear as it is not enabled within the account.
fields.summary: Boards tab shows no content

fields.description:
All my other pipelines are configured in the same manner and are working this error is being returned on one of my repositories.

fields.summary: Not able to login to ECR

fields.description: We’re migrating from Azure Devops to Bitbucket Pipelines. One nice feature in ADO is the option for the author or reviewer of a pull request to flag a PR to auto-complete once all prerequisites for merging are complete. For example after the required number of reviewers have approved the PR and/or the CI pipeline successfully completed.
fields.summary: Auto-merge flag on PR once all prerequisites are met
Dependency caches show "You haven't added any dependency caches yet" despite caches: - node step

fields.description:
I am getting a 403 Forbidden error when calling Diff and DiffStat APIs from C# client. I am able to do the following calls successfully in C#.\\
POST: *GET TOKEN:* [https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/access_token|https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/access_token]\\
GET:  *GET BRANCHES:* [https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{accountId}/{repository}/refs/branches?page=1&pagelen=100|https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/%257B%257BaccountId%257D%257D/%257Brepository%257D/refs/branches%3Fpage%3D1%26pagelen%3D100]

POST: *CREATE PULL REQUEST:* [https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{accountId}/{repository}/pullrequests|https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/%257B%257BaccountId%257D%257D/%257Brepository%257D/pullrequests]

The following requests are failing from C# although they succeed from *POSTMAN* and *Node.JS*:

GET: *GET PULL REQUEST DIFF:* [https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{accountId}/{repository}/pullrequests/{pullRequestId}/diff/|https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/%257B%257BaccountId%257D%257D/%257Brepository%257D/pullrequests/%257BpullRequestId%257D/diff/]

GET: *GET PULL REQUEST DIFFSTAT:* [https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{accountId}/{repository}/pullrequests/{pullRequestId}/diffstat|https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/%257B%257BaccountId%257D%257D/%257Brepository%257D/pullrequests/%257BpullRequestId%257D/diffstat]

I am using the following as the Authorization Header:

{code:csharp}
            httpClient.DefaultRequestHeaders.Authorization = new AuthenticationHeaderValue("Bearer", token);
{code}
fields.summary: 403 Forbidden error when calling Diff and DiffStat APIs from C# client. Works in POSTMAN and Node.js

fields.description: We skip steps in our CI pipeline if that portion of the repository has not changed from the master branch. It would be nice to be able to set a “skipped” status on the step, rather than it showing as successful with no test results.
fields.summary: Support skipped status in Pipelines

fields.description:
I have enabled to “release/” as prefix for “release specific branches”. Then I tried to create a branch “v6.2“ under “Create branch” menu with “Release” as “Branch Type” and “development” as “Branch Type”.

I got error “We couldn’t create a branch \n If this keeps happening [contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/]”.

Can you help by resolving this issue
fields.summary: Unable to create a branch with "release/" prefix

fields.description:
Depending on the day and other seemingly random circumstances pipelines fail to clone the repository and thus pipelines fail arbitrarily. Failures have increased to more than 50% of pipeline runs. Clone command is uneditable and therefore cannot be changed and fixed by users. Bitbucket code called and subsequent error displays as below:

{code}
+ hg clone --noupdate https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/$BITBUCKET_REPO_FULL_NAME . && hg update -C "a02333582d8eb338652cf1fda0f5d1f1f514d31a" && test -e bitbucket-pipelines.yml
applying clone bundle from https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/0eb35ab0-1269-49f9-877b-e31f1642de9b/binary?client=1fb14c7c-95ae-40a6-a6a3-7a971c869c04&token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJhY2Nlc3MiOnsidXJuOmZpbGVzdG9yZTpmaWxlOjBlYjM1YWIwLTEyNjktNDlmOS04NzdiLWUzMWYxNjQyZGU5YiI6WyJyZWFkIl19LCJleHAiOjE1NjU2MzU2NzMsImlzcyI6IjFmYjE0YzdjLTk1YWUtNDBhNi1hNmEzLTdhOTcxYzg2OWMwNCIsIm5iZiI6MTU2NTYzNTI1M30.4x6Dmv7JFGeyl8L2YBWZs4_MVsoj5E-QUVKVjcEnyt8
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
transaction abort!
rollback completed
abort: stream ended unexpectedly  (got 15920 bytes, expected 32768)
{code}

Repository is below bitbuckets soft-limit for size and adding the “size: 2x” does not improve the situation. Pipeline images is node: 8
fields.summary: Pipelines fail to clone repository

fields.description:
If a user comments on an issue in Bitbucket's issue tracker, this user will automatically be watching this issue.

This feature request is to prevent this from happening, and only add a "watch" if the user specifically selects that they want to watch this issue.
fields.summary: Do not automatically watch an issue when you comment on it

fields.description: When I drag tasks to in-progress they fail because they haven’t been assigned to me as an owner. This should be done automatically if I drag them they should be assigned to me. Or even better show a popup that the task is unassigned and it will be assigned to me when I press ok
fields.summary: When updating a task to in-progress automatically assign it to me (if it's unassigned)

fields.description:
Step to reproduce:

# create a new pull request
# edit the pull request
# click on reviewers and the textbox to select new reviewers display

expected: to be able to select a new reviewer

result: cannot focus on the textbox
fields.summary: Cannot add a new reviewer at editing state

fields.description:
Based on a recent meeting of Team Awesome (minus Gary) held on 2019.02.14

Action key:

```

Action | Meaning

----
Keep.  | no action

X.     | drop

+.     | add

?      | TBD

->     | rename

```

```

Column                              Action

obs_id                              Keep.

dataset_id                          Keep.

loc_id                              Keep.

taxon_id                            Keep.

observer                            Keep.

obsdate                             Keep.

d_detection_circumstance_id         Keep.

absent_ind                          Keep.

d_tax_eval_change_reason_id         Rename?

‌                                    Slightly deceptive title. This column is

‌                                    meant to connote why a "taxon_id" was

‌                                    (re)assigned from what was originally found

‌                                    in the input. Per the description of the

‌                                    default row this column references, the

‌                                    current default actually makes very little

‌                                    sense.

confidence_notes                    -> eval_comments

d_tax_confidence_id                 X.

‌                                    Several different values are set in this

‌                                    column across different observations,

‌                                    meaning it's likely been semi-manually

‌                                    populated during upload. Notes should be

‌                                    migrated to eval_comments.

tax_confidence_by                   X.

tax_confidence_date                 X.

tax_conflict_ind                    -> sys_tax_conflict_ind

tax_conflict_notes                  X.

loc_description                     Keep.

d_mapping_confidence_id             X.

mapping_confidence_by               X.

mapping_confidence_date             X.

mapping_conflict_ind                Keep.

‌                                    There appear to be no human-set flags in

‌                                    this column:

‌                                    SELECT COUNT(*) FROM observation WHERE

‌                                        mapping_conflict_ind

‌                                        AND (

‌                                            mapping_conflict_notes

‌                                            NOT LIKE 'Possible issue%'

‌                                        );

mapping_conflict_notes              Keep.

‌                                    There appear to be no human-set notes in

‌                                    this column, as only system-messages are

‌                                    reflected when searching on unique values:

‌                                    SELECT DISTINCT mapping_conflict_notes

‌                                    FROM observation;

d_range_confidence_id               X.

range_confidence_by                 X.

range_confidence_date               X.

range_life_history_conflict_ind     -> sys_range_life_history_conflict_ind

range_detectability_conflict_ind    -> sys_range_detectability_conflict_ind

range_occurrence_conflict_ind       -> sys_range_occurrence_conflict_ind

range_conflict_notes                X.

‌                                    There appear to be no human-set notes in

‌                                    this column, as only system-messages are

‌                                    reflected when searching on unique values.

obsdate_daterange                   Keep.

d_obsdate_confidence_id             X.

‌                                    Several different values are set in this

‌                                    column across different observations,

‌                                    meaning it's likely been semi-manually

‌                                    populated during upload. Notes should be

‌                                    migrated to eval_comments.

obsdate_confidence_by               X.

obsdate_confidence_date             X.

obsdate_error                       Keep.

obsdate_conflict_ind                -> sys_obsdate_conflict_ind

‌                                    There appear to be no human-set flags in

‌                                    this column.

obsdate_conflict_notes              X.

‌                                    There appear to be no human-set notes in

‌                                    this column, as only system-messages are

‌                                    reflected when searching on unique values.

observer_notes                      X.

‌                                    This column has only ever been used to

‌                                    echo the contents of the WOS "Observer

‌                                    Activity" field, which is also expressed in

‌                                    `obs_code_link`. No information will be lost

‌                                    as a result of dropping this column.

‌                                    Though WOS was intended to write an

‌                                    observer's field-notes to this column, this

‌                                    was never set up. "obs_comments" will be

‌                                    used instead.

habitat_description                 Keep.

d_habitat_confidence_id             X.

habitat_confidence_by               X.

habitat_confidence_date             X.

habitat_conflict_ind                X.

‌                                    No observations currently have this flag

‌                                    set. If it is determined at a later date

‌                                    that it's useful to automatically overlay

‌                                    landcover or other habitat-related layers

‌                                    with observation-points, we can add a

‌                                    similar column back to this table.

habitat_conflict_notes              X.

‌                                    There appear to be no human-set notes in

‌                                    this column.

obs_comments                        Field notes from observer(s) should be

‌                                    stored here.

internal_notes                      Keep.

created_date                        Keep.

created_by                          Keep.

modified_date                       Keep.

modified_by                         Keep.

d_sensitivity_sunset_id             Keep.

d_land_ownership_detail_id          Keep.

eval_fail_ind                       Keep.

‌                                    Note that certain records may fail

‌                                    evaluation (per database folk) before a

‌                                    biologist looks. Reason for failure (or a

‌                                    pass despite system-set flags) should

‌                                    generally be noted regardless of whether

‌                                    it's a biologist commenting or not.

‌                                    Constraints could be written to enforce

‌                                    these things.

system_conflict_notes               -> sys_conflict_comments.

‌                                    Keys should be tweaked in trigger-code to

‌                                    reflect the nature of the conflict in

‌                                    addition to the source obs-detail (if any)

‌                                    e.g. 'obs_tally 1734 life_history' and/or

‌                                    'obs_tally 1734 value' instead of just

‌                                    'obs_tally 1734'.

‌                                    Main comments should appear similarly as

‌                                    'main occurrence', 'main detectability',

‌                                    etc.

eval_date                           +.

‌                                    Needs some WHEN-guarded triggers to set

‌                                    when eval_* fields are touched.

eval_by                             +.

‌                                    This should be a `person_org_link`

‌                                    reference and will need some logic attached

‌                                    to it to make sure it actually indicates a

‌                                    biologist's link when "biol_eval_ind" is

‌                                    true; database folk need not apply.

‌                                    This should indicate the last reviewer who

‌                                    looked at the record IN ITS ENTIRETY.

biol_eval_ind                       +.

‌                                    Indicates whether a biologist reviewed the

‌                                    record or not. Column-comments should

‌                                    indicate that records not be partially

‌                                    reviewed such that mixed "eval_by" values or

‌                                    such things would be needed structurally.

user_conflict_response              +.

‌                                    Separately captures a user's response to

‌                                    system-flags.  In some cases this user may

‌                                    be the original observer, but this may also

‌                                    be a third party merely in charge of input,

‌                                    who may just place contact-information

‌                                    here.  Collection of such responses is not

‌                                    mandatory, but may be helpful for adjusting

‌                                    range-maps or evaluating individual

‌                                    observations.

```

Also see email from Melanie dated 10/4.2016 with subject heading: "some changes to observation table based on my experiences thus far"
fields.summary: Editor Test

Console shows error:

fields.description: In [https://bitbucket.org/hqif/sparrow/src/1e12750e79eebd2c23507bb1d2aaf25fe0fefe0f/database/src/main/docker/readme.md?at=master|https://bitbucket.org/hqif/sparrow/src/1e12750e79eebd2c23507bb1d2aaf25fe0fefe0f/database/src/main/docker/readme.md%3Fat%3Dmaster] (private repo) section “Export the full database” point 4 contains a multiline code block between numbered line items. This renders correctly in IntelliJ IDEA but fails to render as code in Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Markdown code block does not render correctly

fields.description: Repository language list is a fixed one, and does not allow adding new one at the account level. Some of the languages are internal to the organization and need not be known to the world. Would it be possible to support this at the Bitbucket cloud account level?.
fields.summary: Custom languages for repository

fields.description: It would be great to be able to trigger a deployment from Bitbucket pipelines that would not be marked complete until a webhook provided to the step in an environment variable is hit indication success or failure.
fields.summary: Add support for asynchronous deployment

fields.description:
Currently, if you deleted a branch, there's no way to know who and how the branch got deleted.

*Feature request*:

It would be best if we could have a feature to allow users to keep track deleted branches.
fields.summary: Possibility to keep track deleted branches

fields.description: All merge requests showing “Unable to merge“ even though there is no conflicts. And all usernames are showing unkown user.
fields.summary: Unable to proceed with merge requests.

fields.description:
All users showing as Unknown user

While merging pull request getting error as “Unable to Merge“
fields.summary: Unable to Merge issue
Not able to create branch

fields.description: *Unable to merge*
fields.summary: Unable to merge

fields.description: All User become Unknown User, please ASAP fix this. Thanks
fields.summary: All User become Unknown User, please ASAP fix this. Thanks

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We are enforcing some rules for commits in bitbucket. Earlier in Bitbucket server I was using YACC plugin. However, this plugin is not available in cloud version.([https://github.com/sford/yet-another-commit-checker/issues/186|https://github.com/sford/yet-another-commit-checker/issues/186]) Is there any alternatives plugin for YACC in cloud? Request you to please share the details.

Regards,

Maya Shankar
fields.summary: Alternative for YACC plugin in Bitbucket cloud
[Pipelines] Not invalidating Javascript Package in cache when using Github repository

fields.description:
Hi,

We use the approvals feature, that is we each member of our team working on the code repository clicks “Approve” button on commits in the Bitbucket cloud UI. In the previous version of the UI, in the list of commits the whether if a commit was approved it was displayed in two ways:

* with a green tick icon, if the commit was approved by me
* with a gray tick icon, if the commit was approved by somebody else

I relied on this feature - this was my way to find the commits that I haven’t yet approved. In the new version of UI the icon is always green, regardles if it was approved by me or somebody else. Can you maybe bring back the old behaviour?

–

Best Regards,\\
Wojciech Gdela.
fields.summary: Ability to distinguish my approvals from other approvals (green vs gray icon)
